This is such a great model describing strengths-based #socialwork using Appreciative Inquiry
Start with 1️⃣a conversation, not an assessment 2️⃣what they CAN do, not what the can’t do 3️⃣assets in their networks & communities, not with a service resource
Thanks for sharing @franlc https://t.co/3ywc7NavJX

Breakfast #Ghana style, with just the right amount of tropical breeze and palm tree shade. You are invited 😋 https://t.co/X2Y2gCxlKU

There are unimaginable and decreasing layers of poverty here in #Ghana as in all low & middle income countries It’s so terribly sad to see it up close & personal There is a daily hustle to survive; families, tribes & communities bond in adversity #Africa

Leaving #Accra & heading out west this morning, travelling to the orphanage in the Central Region
Unfortunately the wealth, affluence & development in the capital diminishes mile by mile as we leave the city. The struggle is real ❤️🇬🇭 #Ghana #Africa https://t.co/3SAVG27uzp

Mum & I arrived safely in #Accra last night Everyone here, & I mean everyone, is happy, cheerful, welcoming, smiley & joyful, as always 🤗
Accra’s beautiful new international airport is now fully open & in fine form
Onwards & upwards #Ghana ❤️ 🇬🇭 ❤️

@JT100_London @NHS_ELFT Sorry to hear about your experience, I hope ur ok. The Trust has been rated outstanding by the CQC twice, so I reckon the majority of people must surely get great care. However I only talk about my personal experience and the care I received. Come along to the AGM 😊

I’m chuffed to be speaking at @NHS_ELFT AGM about my experience of using their #mentalhealth services. The impact of receiving outstanding services when I was vulnerable has had a profound impact on me as a #nurse & leader... we should all aspire to be better together https://t.co/2dHtJTNh2p
